bow: im terrible cook and it makes me feel like failure follow recipes but they dont turn out tasting very good its very discouraging and makes me dread meal times hear stories about mothers who make the best meals and have these amazing signature dishes and it makes me feel so bad feel like the worst mother wife can anyone give me advice on how to improve my cooking or give me any foolproof recipes first no matter what your cooking is like you are great mom cooking is one way to nurture but there are so many others can you say more about what you don like in your cooking wrong texture not enough flavor too much of the wrong flavors second when was easing into cooking felt the easiest things were soups or stir fries using prepared broth or sauces look for broth or sauces that you like the taste of chop veggies and prepare protein to go into them and cook that if you find things that work for your family you can go from there and look at the ingredient list try making the broth or sauce yourself as you gain confidence there are often lessons classes offered in restaurants or grocery stores if you live near city some are expensive and some are pretty reasonably priced they can be really fun youtube is also great resource if you find other busy mom bloggers with style you like really like binging with babish and his beginner series the only way to get better is practice and just like learning any new skill you suck in the beginning find with toddler and one on the way that sheet pan dinners are great you take 10 15 minutes to prep and throw everything on few cookie sheets then just bake your meat and veggies for ~30 minutes and you have dinner ready gives me time to hang out with my son while dinner is cooking and get hot meal on the table also really love my instant pot for making one pot meals on the same premise little bit of prep time then set it and walk away while dinner cooks in short amount of time you can also look into crock meals so that you have some go to big batch items like chili or stew that feeds everyone for few meals and that saves on your time as well try to make big batch of soup stew chilli on the weekend so we have lunches throughout the week and then freeze half of it for later or emergency dinners meal planning can also be key take time atbthe start of your week to set basic outline of food meals for the week it also helps with your grocery list and staying on budget just remember to be flexible sometimes you don feel like the thing you planned to make on certain night of the week and add in take out night every so often you can swap things around as needed good luck we re on the same boat mostly rely on recipes find online and sometimes it just does turn our well but what learned is when seasoning add salt pepper or whatever seasoning you need little by little it always easier to add bit more than to have too much also started cooking easy meals until feel more confident to try something else making meal plan is also helpful so you have an idea what to buy what to make budget and whatnot do worry though the more you keep at it the better you ll get good luck am terrible cook so just do do lot of it kids are 13 and and no one has starved to death make hamburger helper or frozen corndogs at least once week keep ton of vegetables on hand and do lot of assemble your own type meals ll brown some hamburger meat and then they will make tacos or sloppy joe or nachos or mac and cheese to go with it they also are used to fend for yourself as the response to what for dinner do cook am not good at it and do enjoy it my boys still like me still get best mom ever quite bit around here they re well adjusted straight students with healthy bmis my friends and family know do cook get assigned drinks and ice at every holiday and social event ya girl can pack an ice chest that for dang sure ve had few raised eyebrows over the years it awesome because then immediately know do like that judgemental bitch my oldest cooks more than me at this point the kid makes mean pan of scrambled eggs if you want to get better at it then practice and get better at it if you want to removed crock pot recipes are great follow the recipe and few hours later wham bam thank you ma am and you ve got dinner these are great year around and super confidence builder also not tasting great may just mean you re missing something as simple as salt try recipe and if it seems bland or not good make it again and play bit with the seasonings another thing that helped me is to make stuff familiar with or grew up with my ability to trout is infinitely better when familiar with what think it should taste like and remember practice makes perfect good luck did know how to cook at all when got married would make simple things like spaghetti with canned sauce tacos hamburgers not the healthiest but would also try new recipe every couple of weeks do know what wrong with your food but here list of what did to be good cook read the whole recipe before you start anything prepare your vegetables and meat before you start cooking used to try to chop vegetables while cooking other things it always ends badly find friend or family member who makes something you enjoy ask to cook it with them and try to learn from them keep trying new recipes after while you start to get instincts for how things should look and taste watch youtube videos to see how to chop different vegetables taste as you go and make sure to salt while you re cooking throwing all of the salt on at the end makes it taste bad buy the proper tools would try to whisk with fork and cook in the wrong kind of pans and it would mess up the consistency of things or change the cook times start with online recipes lot of them have step by step instructions with pictures 10 do stress some days spend hours making the most delicious healthy meals and my kids ask for hot dogs and my husband has been snacking the whole time so the only one who eats it it does make you bad mom or wife that you are perfect in this one way it just takes lot of focused effort and time was confident with my cooking for years after got married now enjoy it and feel like pretty good at it if you have some specific areas that you struggle with would love to give you more tips can not stress enough how bad was at cooking when was younger if you re struggling with something probably struggled with it too did know what garlic was when got married like literally had seen garlic salt but never stopped to wonder what it even was are you burning the food is it over cooked if not it may honestly be different opinions on what tastes good it took me along time to figure this out my husband was raised on canned food and anything canned taste good to him anything not canned doesn taste good will never add as much salt as he prefers don cook the way his mom did cook the way my grandmother cooked with high quality ingredients this is very strange to my husband who never even saw most vegetables or fruits growing up honestly can not make meals that please him yet when my siblings or mom visits they love my food personally was treated like crap by my stepmom who saved the fresh food for her kid and forced us to eat rubbery canned foods she literally made two meals so can eat can food because they bring up bad memories so we just have different opinions on what taste good he likes hamburger helper my son and hate it it not that bad cook he just has completely different tastes another suggestion on top of all the great advice already in these comments have you considered trying week of one of the meal kits they re definitely pricier than cooking from scratch but you get all the ingredients you need neatly packaged by meal with step by step recipe with pictures right there in the box ve tried several different ones and while the convenience was the biggest factor for me they do good job of showing you how to make some delicious meals in pretty manageable way plus if you like recipe and it turns out well it easy enough to go buy the ingredients yourself and make it from scratch next time no particular company reccommend found they re all mostly interchangeable so if it fits in your budget it an option to consider you are not terrible mom the most important thing is you are actually feeding your baby few years ago was not so great but here lately have begun to impress myself it just takes time amp x200b what find easiest chop up veggies and chicken lay them on cookie sheet and drizzle olive oil on top season with your choice of spices also make white rice cups of water per cup of rice amp x200b try perfecting simple easy meals first and throwing in veggies where you can ll make spaghetti on my lazy days and chop zucchini and bell peppers to throw in with the ground turkey or ll throw in spinach with the pasta sauce it okay to cut yourself some slack and not make dinner every single day there are days where make frozen pizza ll throw in spinach and mushrooms on it and serve tomatoes on the side amp x200b find what works for you and keep practicing you got this use lot of recipes from www budgetbytes com https www budgetbytes com her recipes tend to be easy to follow and focus lot on developing good flavors as bonus they are also easy on the household budget there have been some recipes from this blog that my family did like but do think ve ever had one that did turn out she doing vegetarian january challenge so that what is all over her front page right now would recommend clicking on the recipes link to get look at all her recipes all sorted into categories amp x200b in my house we also love pasta of all varieties buy the refrigerated or frozen ravioli tortellini lot add some pesto or good pasta sauce we like bertolli or barilla salad and some bread and you ve got dinner amp x200b if your family likes food that is bit spicier simmer sauces from the indian food section can be delicious curries are favorite in my house and so are tikka masala sauces cook up some chicken or pork add the simmer sauce and simmer for about 15 minutes or so serve over rice with usually veggie mix on the side amp x200b cooking is learned skill for most people as with anything practice makes perfect find some recipes that you love and gradually add new ones to expand your repertoire amp x200b personally say just dumb it down for while keep it simple chicken veggies rice for dinner pork chops veggies noodles steak veggies and potatoes ground beef turkey chicken and make different kinds of tacos wraps sauces or even just bunch of different canned beans chinese is easy to do this way as well cut up chicken some frozen broccoli and some asian mrs dash over rice and viola you have an easy stir fry you can do the same thing with steak or pork or shrimp or garbanzo beans season everything to your taste you can get bunch of different varieties of mrs dash seasonings that make the same base ingredients taste very different every day and build from there there lot of variety you can come up with from just the simple ingredients plus it can be pretty cheap to do it that way you can get frozen veggies and rice for super cheap and large pack of chicken can last us whole week if you thin it out and cut it up if you stick to the same couple base ingredients you can make bunch of different meals without having to buy much of extras every week that just go toward one meal you are cooking that is success in itself second previous rev for using the slow cooker add chicken cut up carrots potatoes celery and add bay leaf and bit of water let it cook all day and salt is it possible that you just need to season yournfood sometimes don put in enough salt and it makes everything just ho hum also recommend cooking from tried and true recipe sources first america text kitchen is my go to they test the crap out of their recipes so find them pretty foolproof they also have number of books that focus on semi homemade including one for the slow cooker also the skinnytaste website is pretty good her maple dijon drumsticks are go to slow cooker meal in our house bc it only ingredients good luck bet your cooking is better than you think find that being the cook typically don think my food tastes as good bc ve been smelling it while cooking if that makes any sense was terrible cook until couple years ago my mother and grandmother cooked everything out of can or box now pretty good learning more every day first do trust the internet recipes fell into the trap of beautiful pinterest meals and super easy recipes from small blogs majority of them just are not good especially if you are familiar with cooking techniques lot of easy recipes oversimplify steps or omit the complicated ones entirely look at allrecipes com and stick to things with very high ratings with lot of reviews or pick up cookbook or two from the library second do some research would suggest any cookbook from america test kitchen very easy to understand and explains how to do stuff and why you re doing it that way got the science of good cooking for christmas and it game changer the more you know about why you re doing stuff or adding ingredients in that order the better you ll be went to the local library checked out dozen books that sounded interesting and then bought the ones that really helped me third seasoning spices and seasoning is so important smell and taste everything as you go along found most recipes online suggest half the spice and double the sugar butter that actually needed was always afraid of salt but it makes such difference add tiny bit at time forth practice when something does come out right google it look it up in the cooking subreddits try to figure out what went wrong and try again to save on waste usually make half batch of anything have made before the cooking subreddits are really good too and alton brown has videos on youtube to explain the how and why of cooking his recipes are consistently awesome too you dont have to be martha stewart but having one or two signature dishes is total ego boost hey do feel so bad cooking skills do define how good of mother or wife woman is also cooking is something that needs to be learned even the best cooks had to learn and experiment at least one time in their lives was born in family of cooks so the pressure was really baddd like thought was never gon na be good cook because of how high the standards should be anywho eventually learned maybe am not as good as how my elders are when it comes to cooking but did learn and somehow still learning currently am confident in my cooking but still admit that am very far from best still make unfixable mistakes but do feel bad it happens one advantage have is that my husband was raised in home of not so good cooks so there that lol so everything cook is still tasty for him apparently reject cook from family of good cooks is already goddess for man who practically never really tasted great home cooked meals anyhow my cooking advice is to try to start small and master an easy dish if you can master seasoning simple dish you will eventually have the pulse to season bigger dish say be an omelet master or sunny side up master you will then quickly improve and move on to more complex dish my other advice in cooking is to not hurry follow your instincts when it comes to time and temperature recipes are great guides but it still important to follow your guts 100 believe that you will be good cook soon there is absolutely no reason for it to be impossible good luck this is really great advice also found online recipes to be super helpful my mother is an incredible cook but anytime made recipe of hers it was not good and then id call and she would tell me how she actually makes it so frustrating have found that find person like like alton brown and see if they have recipe first before go scrounging through the internet my favorite people recipes are alton brown ree drummond molly yeh for anything baked consult the king arthur flour website pro tip they have baking hotline you can call and ask questions its awesome the great thing about cooking is you can and will get better the more you do it and you will figure out how you and your kids like things made almost always double or triple the amount of garlic that called for and am not big fan of black pepper so often leave it out it the little things like that that you will figure out that will make it easier my final piece of cooking advice especially with little ones buy slow cooker use it all the time it so easy and delicious and quick how long have you been cooking like anything else cooking is skill that takes lot of time to develop started cooking around 21 and ruined lot of stuff 26 now and much more comfortable in my ability after lots of ups and downs actually learned ton from the food network honestly maybe most of what know is from the food network since my mom barely cooked when we were growing up my advice is to start with pasta dishes found them to be the most forgiving if things go slightly awry buy kenji lopez book food lab it explains in scientific and numerous way how to cook lots of basic things he explains really basic things that you might not know things like leave your meat out to warm up before frying how to salt something properly proper pans to used correct temperature etc been cooking for 20 years before bought his book and it helped me fine tune it like cooking lesson without leaving your house also lots of beginning cooks have food that doesn turn out the first time they make it it learning curve the important thing is you stick with it hi there no advice on cooking am terrible at it and my husband enjoys it so he pretty much does it all just wanted to pop in and say that everyone has different likes and talents and being poor cook in no way reflects on you as mom or wife women tend to pressure ourselves to take care of everything would your husband be willing able to cook few nights week to take the pressure off of you if not you can stick to easy things hot dogs frozen meals crockpot stuff etc until you re feeling little more confident and or your kids are less demanding most importantly can you change how you think about this issue so that poor cook bad mom wife person always use way more garlic than recipe calls for way more also when you re cooking dish find three or four recipes look through them all and see which elements are essential which are most to your taste and get an idea of proper cooking times the exact amounts of most spices really does matter so if recipe tells you to put in of teaspoon of cumin but you especially like cumin put it in slowly until it tastes right to you taste as you cook so you can figure out what it needs as you go splash of white vinegar or apple cider vinegar to soups stews and sauces really rounds out the flavor so does tiny hint of ginger or cayenne in dishes that do normally need it last but not least if by some slim chance you are anywhere near socal will be more than happy to give you few cooking lessons lots of folks here have really good ideas for you ll reiterate that it takes practice site love is http simplyrecipes com the pages aren bloated with bunch of blog posts and ads and the recipes are easy to understand and usually fairly easy to execute the woman who started it got lot of her initial recipes from her parents who are outstanding cooks particularly in the tex mex department one thing ll mention if you have little kids under age it might be challenge to devote the mental energy to learning new cooking skills stay at home parent to year old and year old and was decent cook before had them but my desire and ability to explore new cooking skills has certainly waned just don have the time anymore hate cooking when recipe does turn out it feels like such waste of time sorry that happening to you lot lately you might like chef john in youtube his videos are so soothing and he explains some of the techniques that other recipes assume you already know on mobile so ca link to his page but if you scroll through his most popular videos bet you will find something you enjoy making there is so much good advice here don think have any cooking stuff to add do want to say that you are absolutely not failure you re cooking for your family you re taking the time to make them meal and you care and you re trying my dad would always burn his toast to hell because that how his mother made it when he was kid so that how he liked it best add spicy english or dijon mustard to almost all of my savory sauces because that how my mother did it and it just tastes more like meal when it tastes like my childhood dinners no matter what you make or how it appreciated and betting it ll be replicated in the future so your family can remember these times mine is short practice amp experiment many dishes were thrown out but now love cooking taste it as you cook see what missing salt sweet tang texture etc start simple—everything doesn have to be gourmet cook handful of acceptable dishes multiple times to make just right don let internet perfection wear you down sear the meat sear it never trust recipe that says just throw that roast in the crock pot cold sear it this adds flavor and texture necessary for most meals if not it often comes out mealy and tasteless or dry beef roast get 3lb ish chuck roast season with salt pepper garlic powder sear on both sides well after searing leave the drippings in the pan and add cans of either progresso or campbell french onion soup and deglaze the drippings off the pan pour over meat in slow cooker cook on low for about hours optional like fresh carrots and fresh snap beans put little garlic and butter in the pan with the drippings and cook the veggies for couple minutes not to make them soft totally cooked just enough to season the veggies and get little garlic on them in the drippings put the veggies under the roast in the crock pot to cook better like jasmine rice with everything and make it in cheap rice cooker because it 10x better or put my roast over egg noodles bonus crockpot liners work great it like crockpot condom doesn affect the food and don have to clean it after you also have to keep in mind loads of practice no one starts off being really good some ppl need more practice then others and that fine some basic cooking classes might bolster your confidence as well learned by working at restaurants outside of those dishes not so good asked my grandma to teach me few dishes tried her fudge this year and it not good usually it takes about five tries to get it right for me so 2013 that fudge will be spot on cooking can be intimidating and it even trickier if you don enjoy it have two small children and do enjoy cooking however rarely have time to cook meal while keeping an eye on them rely pretty heavily on my crock pot more so than my instant pot prep the meal sometimes at bed time then pop it in the fridge and pull it out the next morning to start cooking also make lot of meals at nap time have no shame in cooking in the crock pot do it almost daily all year round invest in one with timer too it helps to keep it from over cooking if that not in your budget it wasn in mine until scored one at thrift store with timer used my christmas tree timer on my crock pot lol to turn it on and shut it off still do this from time to time if am using multiple crock pots for one meal even do our entire thanksgiving dinner in crock pots and roaster every year that right don use my oven lol load them up walk away and enjoy some wine while it cooks have you tried following cooking videos on you tube of simple crock pot recipes find some of my biggest family food hits are when keep it simple less than ingredients things familiar with salt pepper garlic and protein with veggies chicken veggie soup is simple and requires little prep you can add noodles if you want as well you add them the last hour for cooking or cook them separate this works in the crock pot or on the stove for an hour here the recipe rotisserie chicken from your local grocery store precooked lbs celery stocks chopped cup of frozen onions chopped you can find these in your freezer department bag baby carrots if chopping or collecting the ingredients is intimidating look in the produce section for mirepoix mix usually found by the lettuce and pre pared veggies this is prechopped veggies everything you need for the veggies in this recipe just dump them in tablespoon of dried parsley tablespoon of garlic powder teaspoons of salt and pepper quarts of chicken stock low sodium put it the crock pot for hours on low add pasta of your choice for the last hour of cooking and turn the crock pot to high or cook pasta separately and add minutes before serving my family likes egg noodles with it you got this mom you can cook and striving to do so shows how much you care about nourishing your family it takes time trial and error but over time you ll get the hang of it one more tip love this you tube channel for crock pot stuff and recipes she makes it easy to follow and everything is usually premixed seasoning packets cans of soup etc here chicken and gravy you can subscribe to her channel too good luck https youtu be f1dm gsdjz4 keep it simple get good at one thing then try something new make sure you re using enough salt get meat thermometer so you re not over cooking your meats when you follow recipe choose simple ish one and follow it exactly do try to eyeball amounts get food scale if you can taste as you go when it says add salt and pepper to taste that means add some taste it add little more repeat until you get it right some of my favorite recipes have very few ingredients bread for example is just flour yeast salt and water ingredients but with the right technique you can turn them into something amazing suggest starting with something super simple that most kids love like spaghetti and meatballs get good at making meatballs make them every sunday when you re happy with your meatballs you can start making your own sauce once you ve mastered that you can learn to make lasagna you are wonderful mother way before cooking comes into play ve felt something similar when started my career and was working 50 hr weeks are could no longer cook for my family felt like shitty wife and shitty mother cooking doesnt not invalidate the love care and passion you have for your family the fact that you re willing to try says it all right there now onto actual cooking advice pick region and master those dishes different kinds of food are cooked very similarly depending on the culture love asian food my husband loves asian food cook lot of asian food studied the recipes for me its helps watching them be cooked theres couple youtube channels watched cooking with dog seogyong longest maangachi etc all great cooks all with good cook books and step by step processes who adjust their recipes to be easy to make another commenter said you can not go wrong with stir fry and you really ca you ve got this practice in small amounts cook for yourself if you can manage to eat it and enjoy it then your family will too removed got book called common sense guide to cooking or something similar not at home to get the title my dad taught me how to cook our family recipes but didn know lot of the names or terminology that book helped me with ideas how to prepare food different ways etc would always do trial run before serving it to anyone outside of my house but it really does get better with practice you re not failure you are great mom because you care keep practicing there are lots of cooking videos online that go through recipes step by step maybe watching them visually will help you then you can pause the video and cool along with the video also pinterest has lot of easy recipes for all types of dietary needs they often have links to videos one you try so points there two you will never be try to cook frozen turkey in not turned on convection oven bad like my grandma so you re good figure out one great meal you do and do well maybe take some cooking classes don feel bad for wanting to learn and improve some moms just give up and order takeout this is me part of the reason think might be because when started learning to cook was probably like 19 or so and was doing weight watchers most of the recipes didn call for stuff like butter when got older would cook and limit oils and butters and it just never compared to the homestyle cooking my husband grew up loving additionally my family is hispanic caribbean and my dad used to cook almost exclusively latin american and asian for some reason foods so would always have taste for that the recipes would select were almost always ethnic in nature but was trying to make these things with all that weight watchers training in mind plus since was now living in the midwest and not in houston or south texas anymore was always missing important ingredients because there weren any ethnic food stores around lastly my husband and kid are midwesterners obviously so get all excited about making some dish with rice or with trying to do something like enchiladas the right way and they just were meh about it or totally turned off would try to do something like casseroles that midwestern right haha and my husband would be nice but also complain that it was just mash to this day still can cook meal that makes everyone happy which kind of bums me out because really do love cooking as an expression of love and sometimes what cook they really like what ended up working for us was meal delivery program we went with hello fresh looked at our grocery budget and realized it was more cost effective than thought for one before hello fresh would try to meal plan and end up wasting tons of food and money the recipe would call for say little bit of celery but to get that you have to go buy whole stalk so spend money on the whole stalk use little bit and then the rest of the celery rots because my kid hates it and my husband and are too busy to figure out how to use the rest of this celery just couldn figure out how to do meal planning where you make and freeze recipes without wasting tons of food and money we realized we were spending upwards of 500 month on groceries trying to make everyone happy with the meal kit we re spending like 240 month on that getting super yummy dinners week out of it and then we probably spend an additional 100 150 on just like canned soups frozen meals drinks veggies fruits all of which is mostly just what my daughter eats and simply breakfasts and whatever else the meal kit has also been helpful because feel like we never waste food we eat every bite and no food goes in the trash but it also been super helpful in showing me what ve been doing wrong this whole time as cook lastly it awesome because we re actually excited to make meal and sit down and enjoy it together grocery shopping is so much less stressful too since we just buy the same stuff all the time so if it in your budget honestly might just try that just pick one of them and go for it have referral codes if you wan na pm me for one not trying to get deal here not blogger or something haha just offering an idea love to cook and love to teach if you live in middle tn pm me and ll give you some tips in person we can cook some of my most praised dishes and ll give you the recipes because could tell you all day but if don show you may say something you don get or skip step don think thing about but is something nessary for the recipe keep it simple and do multitask take your time when you re trying something new try to avoid stressful situations and last minute solutions think about the various ingredients and how they mix some flavours go better together than others pear blue cheese blueberry cow milk cheeses cream strawberry figs sheep cheese carrots potatoes lamb rosemary tomato mozzarella you get the idea online recipes are often useless they re dime dozen some basic guidelines from the italian kitchen do mix milk and tomato sauce do use flavoured tomato sauces use the ones that only have tomatoes in them and use good quality version good tomato sauce takes time at relatively law heat at least 10 15 min do overcook the pasta basic tomato sauce recipe fry garlic clove in olive oil until golden brown add an anchovy https imgur com qxr8rpk and let it melt pour in the passata https imgur com cjk6mxn fry at low heat until it is mild and soft in flavour you re not simply heating it you re cooking it vegetables cauliflower broccoli carrots potatoes are supreme when roasted in the oven clean them chop them up bite size spread them over oven paper in the oven tray sprinkle olive oil on top salt it bit pepper it bit sprinkle unpeeled garlic cloves around the tray stuff it in at around 200 degrees for 20 45 min depending on your oven check on it often do trust me on the time trust your nose trust your eyes your oven is different from mine you cut your veggies differently from me and like them seared differently start with simple recipes that use fresh ingredients try making the same recipe few times in few weeks try to identify what you didn like about it the first time and see if you can fix it the next time try cooking some of the ingredients separately until you know how long things generally take to reach the level of done ness you prefer never trust the listed times in recipe taste and test food as you cook it to make sure it actually getting done as general rule double the spices in any recipe follow especially garlic also add lots of salt as cook it better to incorporate the salt with the food as it cooks rather than adding it at the end don trust pinterest recipes search recipes online and look for ones with more than stars or buy well reviewed simple cookbook used to be terrible cook but these things ve learned to make food taste good high heat burnt on the outside usually undercooked on the inside no need to cook at this heat unless you re trying to boil something quick med heat is high heat toggle between this and low heat if something looks like it burning lower the heat and flip it season your food before putting it in the oven or stove my go to seasonings are salt pepper adobe sazion garlic powder and onion powder if you like spicy use red pepper rub in seasonings into meat also use sofrito when making stir fry or cooking any veggies in pan just use tablespoons in the pan and mix it all up if you want to make yellow rice buy white rice and put sazion in it while it boiling and mix it get meat thermometer it helps with getting your meats perfectly cooked google what the perfect temp for each meat do be afraid of frozen veggies wash them before for boiling 30 min meals are your friend refuse to spend more than 30 mins in the kitchen cooking unless it holiday learn what you can use as substitutes and learn what side dishes go well with what meat and veggie you got this experiment figure out what you like and what works for you you re not failure cooking is learned process and skill huge part of this is your palate and the palates of your family members the specific problems you re running into weren shared in your original post so disregard this if it isn applicable but if you re used to boxed canned frozen or restaurant food very little that you make is going to taste good to you there so much added to those foods that isn food to make them taste good the good news is that your taste buds regenerate every 10 days so if this is the case stick with it bit and you should find yourself adjusting america test kitchen atk is your friend in case you re unfamiliar they are exactly what their name implies test kitchen simplistically they take 50 macaroni and cheese recipes and find the best one or develop the best one based upon their findings and they also tell you the why behind it which is cool too with the exception of atk find the internet to be more reliable than cookbooks for recipes because of the reviews that being said you do have to poke around in the reviews bit and see if they re skewed by people who have added starred review based upon the recipe *looking* delicious or those who have made it but have made alterations to the original recipe great place to start is with meat and veggies our family tends to stay away from gluten by choice no food allergies so this is our norm and it makes things super easy veggies sautéed in butter or ghee are amazingly easy and tasty and then my main focus is using chicken recipe making burgers etc that all can think of for now but if think of more later ll come back to edit don give up it worth your tenacity in the end would recommend pioneer woman ree drummond if you have library access you can get her books that have step by step instructions and pictures she also has website which is good too but there is something so nice able it having the physical cookbook she also does generally go for pinterest perfect just really good hearty cooking okay so am going to share with you my super easy spaghetti sauce recipe that gets raved about every time make it \*and\* it freezes great so you can always have some on hand hopefully your family likes spaghetti sauce first though ll just add few things that learned since got married and had kids if you do what do and look for recipes online like on pinterest look at the comments or ratings of that recipe first ca tell you how many times made recipe based on how amazing the picture looked only to have it turn out terribly learned to only use vetted recipes because there are \*so\* many out there if you make on you like keep it somehow like physical copies of my recipes so print out the ones have success with and put them in binder make sure you follow recipes exactly and read all the instructions ahead two of my biggest mistakes that still occasionally make are trying to alter recipe on the fly and just reading the directions as cook you ll save yourself world of trouble if you avoid these two things while building up your skills amp x200b chicken rice and veggies for the win practice baked chicken seasoned with just like salt onion powder and garlic powder like the instructions from livestrong but they re all pretty much the same if you google plain baked chicken once you have it down it crazy easy to adapt you bake it the same way but adapt the seasoning with anything like taco seasoning pour bbq sauce over the top marinade in italian dressing so many possibilities the secret ve learned for rice is to cook it in chicken broth not water it makes \*world\* of difference we have rice cooker steamer that use all the time my rice comes out perfect every time and so do steamed veggies this combo is very simple generally cheap and very adaptable way to feed your family if you do have one already invest in slow cooker bigger one since you have family to feed am still learning out to use mine but they are so very useful and can save you lot of time do give up you can do this and with some practice and planning it does have to be stressful okay so here my mom spaghetti sauce recipe tbs onion powder pesto tsp beef buillon granules or balsamic vinegar tsp oregano tsp basil tsp marjoram tsp salt tsp sugar oz cans tomato sauce 12oz tomato paste 28 oz crushed tomatoes or can crushed amp can diced mix all ingredients in my slow cooker and set on low for hours you can also do this in big pot on the stove though ve neve find basic recipe that is ok and master it then tweak it until it mine do mess around with low fat whole milk yogurt cream whole milk etc our bodies need fat and low fat fat free versions do taste as good and also have way more sugar research cuts of meat and what they are good for how they are best prepared cheap cuts and dark meats are great for crockpots and soups bone in skin on chicken is more flavorful and less prone to drying out with boneless skinless chicken and lean red meat or pork cuts marinades are your friend get meat thermometer overcooked meat is bummer vegetables are always better roasted but parboiling boiling for just few minutes can help them cook more evenly especially potatoes recommend finding dishes you do well and start experimenting with changes to those also start with some basics do focus on the recipe itself but on techniques to help enhance your food for example have base start with dice up slices of raw bacon whole onion about tablespoon of butter and about tablespoon of minced onion ll toss it all together and saute them until the bacon is cooked and onions are translucent from there sometimes add chicken stock and bag of green beans and have side of green beans sometimes do add the bacon but do add julienned bell peppers once those are cooked add sliced polish sausage then serve it over angel hair pasta and make sausage and peppers flavors from seasonings can change as they are cooked sometimes adding it while cooking and then little right before it done is good idea when make spaghetti sauce always add some of the garlic onion oregano salt and pepper while browning the beef sure most drains out when you drain the meat but cooking it with the meat will still add flavor once you have some fundamental things down you ll be able to see recipe and know it will take better if do it this way instead of dumping it all into the pan like it says second the slow cooker or if you re like me and you never remember to start it in the morning you could get an electric pressure cooker kept making freezer meals to dump in the slow cooker but never remembered to actually dump them in the slow cooker removed my husband keeps saying his mom couldn cook while he was growing up he doesn hold any anger towards her or felt he suffered any less quality of life growing up think he mostly considers it funny quirk about his mother my own mom has gotten quite experimental in the kitchen in the past few years and is generally unsuccessful but no one would ever tell her and we re all grateful regardless because at least she gets the family together to eat every once in while this entire thread is giving me life here are my 02 learned to cook from my grandmother who learned to cook on her own in the 50 so ton of it was based on new conveniences of the time lot of cream of mushroom soup bisquick centered meals did care it was all delicious but my husband is super fond of many of my favorite childhood meals so am learning to cook different way and it still learning process for me on busy nights can always rely on good jar of sauce frozen meatballs and pasta if feeling fancy ll throw in some mushrooms or green peppers and some fresh parmesan at the end but in any event it always hit simple stuff like this gave me confidence when first started cooking for others crock pot this has saved me so many times and it really is fool proof also just got an instant pot and so far so good similar thinking as crock pot but fast cooking it saved me when realized last mnute needed cooked shredded chicken for recipe and did have the time or space in my kitchen to do it any other way honestly do have signature dish yet ve been married years and have made some things that have been huge hits but not necessarily something that known for thinking that will come but ve also had some duds more than care to admit have subscription to emeals it weekly meal planning service think 10 month that gives you recipes and shopping lists for the ingredients do always use it but it has been useful and the recipes are relatively easy love budgetbytes quality stuff one of my fool proof ones is one pan chicken thighs everything is prepared and put into the oven at once and at the same temp so you don have to juggle bunch of different things ingredients one package boneless skinless chicken thighs large sweet potatoes 5lbs of brussel sprouts love veggies salt pepper olive oil garlic depends on what you have powdered works just fine or the pre minced jars like from costco directions preheat oven to 390f peel sweet potatoes chop to about cubes aiming for even sizes but it doesn have to be perfect clean brussel sprouts cut off the stem ends and half them if you want to they ll cook fine whole too put brussel sprouts and sweet potatoes into large bowl add about tbsp of olive oil tsp salt tsp pepper and garlic to taste probably start with 1tsp if using powdered then stir it all up to evenly coat put plate on top and shake it because it easy and lazy open chicken thighs and rinse with water then drain off as much water as you can place veggies and potatoes on outside edges of large cookie sheet place chicken in middle of cookie sheet sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper flip and do the other side place in oven for 40 minutes then check chicken should be at 185f internally brussel sprouts should be somewhat tender and potatoes you should be able to poke easily with fork and have them slide off without hardly any effort at all if it not quite there yet cook an additional minutes check and repeat until it cooked to the right temp tip if you don have meat thermometer get one it literally took me from lame cook to passable when moved in with my husband who had one tl dr one pan chicken thigh sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts for dinner looks long but just spelled it out crock pot recipes are the best do be afraid to start really basic good pot roast recipe will have your brown the meat sweat the aromatics deglaze the pan fuck that start with raw meat veg and sauce packet ina crock pot see if you like the easy option then build off of that my life each time cook my boyfriend will ask me the following questions comments did you add salt is it supposed to taste like this that isn the way would cook it are you sure you added salt with yr old and 10 month old try to focus but usually end up throwing food together and even when have help with watching the kids and am able to take my time he still says the same thing no idea what the doing wrong guess don got the magic touch 🤷‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️ you re not failure in fact find it admirable that you are trying to be better cook during this busy part of life would start by cooking simple things first properly cooking protein really doesn need much after you master cooking protein then you can add sauces or spices to elevate your meal here how cook steak bring steak to room temperature add salt amp pepper to both sides of the steak heat up cast iron pan with little oil until it really hot and just about to start smoking place the steak into the pan and cook for ~3 mins on each side use thermometer to check the internal temp until it at your desired temp 130 135f for medium rare it so important to use thermometer to get the right temperature it one of the best kitchen tools purchased let the steak rest you can serve this with roasted vegetables usually heat the oven to 400f toss asparagus with extra virgin olive oil salt and pepper it only needs to cook for about mins until it bright green love to roast vegetables because don have to multitask can focus on the protein on the stove and let the oven cook the vegetable after mastering how to cook proteins then you can start to play with spices and sauces if you make steak then you can make chimichurri sauce or pan sauce to the dish you could marinate proteins for another flavor profile you can play with spices to find out what you prefer the beat way to become better cook is to keep cooking and to learn from it trust america test kitchen for delicious recipes that never disappoints if you decide to follow their recipe then recommend that you read the entire recipe before you cook usually read the recipe the night before to make sure that have all my ingredients or grocery list and to have an idea of what to expect good luck in your cooking adventures like others have said be careful of the internet alot of beautiful pictures and terrible recipes online would recommend the pioneer woman she has lots of pictures so you can follow the steps someone suggested alton brown on the network and he reliable too start with this it not very healthy but it delicious https thepioneerwoman com cooking sour cream noodle bake make salad to go with it you can get the mixed bags if you want you should also go to the library and check out some books from america test kitchen pioneer woman and alton brown also have cookbooks their recipes instructions are really detailed and well tested they have some weeknight meal cookbooks and slow cooker cook books if your library doens have them on the shelf you can reserve it or you can probably request it from another library if you re not familiar with this ask the librarian to help you how old are your kids know that my year old will proclaim her unending love for something and tell me it disgusting when make it again hey terrible cook as well eventually learned to lean into it and accept that just do have great palate for the subtleties of spices and how to make everything complement everything else but am really really good at baking it very different skill set and there are lots of easy starter recipes that are basically impossible to screw up maybe try that usually feed my family simple veggies roasted with amp and maybe garlic and proteins that season minimally but offer with store bought sauce try the zhoug from trader joe but serve it with fresh baked bread and really lovely dessert and no one cares can you give more details on what it is that lacking in your food lots of newbie mistakes are things like not salting your food enough or too much the solution is season as you go add little at time at each step and taste as you go when the meat is cooked that leads us to over cooked meat think people are afraid of food bien illness which is fair that they overlook their food get meat thermometer like this one because can stab my biggest piece of meat which theoretically cooks the slowest and close the oven door and just watch till it reaches the right temp print out table of the temp each specific meat is safe to eat at think about what specifically is meh about your food and we can talk about tricks and best practices to avoid there allot of food advice on this thread but it could be something as simple as you cooking recipes that no matter who cooked aren gon na float your boat my husband once tried to make cookies and somehow made cookie soup and tried to boil pasta in bundt pan doesn make him bad parent this is foolproof recipe some of my tips warm the egg before adding the honey and mix tablespoon of honey into the butter before drizzling on the chicken https www allrecipes com recipe 60070 baked honey nut chicken serve with veggies and rice love roasted asparagus or broccoli coat with oil and lots of sea salt bake 400 till tender which is about 20 min for asparagus and 50 for broccoli is there something that you want to learn to cook beef tips and noodles specialty of mine steak chinese swedish meatballs ooohh have another good one but make my own alfredo sauce simple butter cream sauce https www allrecipes com recipe 16723 pesto chicken florentine solidarity sister also suck at cooking most everything is either gross or burnt when was single and childless lived on salads amp sandwiches that was ok for me but my and year olds not so much my kids get veggies because cut them up really really tiny and mix them into pasta sauce from jar we eat lots of raw foods veggies cheese crackers pickles etc make one hell of sandwich if my so is away and need to cook few dinners in row grab the pre prepared chicken dishes from the meat counter at the grocery store already marinated kinda stuff you are not alone luckily my man cooks most nights love starting with copycat recipes for restaurant meals that ve enjoyed because know like them and know how they should taste one of my favorites is chipotle barbacoa copycat recipe copy their guac recipe too and have done their lime cilantro rice as well but ve also looked up recipes for cheesecake factory meals red lobster cheddar biscuits etc even go look up menus for restaurants and copy things like pizza toppings make killer feta kalamata artichoke and balsamic pizza but totally copied it after eating it few times at local tapas place just start with stuff you know you like look up copycat recipe restaurant name food item and give it try and do expect that it going to be perfect the first few times but also do apologize for your cooking you re feeding your family and that is huge gift in and of itself you got this mama my husband has become much more confident with cooking thanks to hello fresh blue apron etc the first time you order they usually give you great deal so we would get the first week or two and then cancel but they go through the steps provide everything and are pretty easy ve kept the recipes and we just go buy the ingredients ourselves now also one of my favorite recipe websites is pioneer woman she posts lot of pictures so you can check and make sure it the right textures and colours as you go along and her cookbooks blog are great and easy to follow hey first practice as often as possible second try recipes you already know you like third start simple lipton makes french onion soup packets add that to pounds of ground beef follow the rest of the recipe throw it in pan and you just made meatloaf it really hard to mess that up and everything is measured out try one pot meals or crock pot meals or instant pot meals they are much easier than traditional meals it literally matter of attacking the ingredients in the proper order and starting it ve got few very simple recipes that started with when first started cooking if you want them pm me atk and cooks country ❤❤ though sometimes they over think things and make recipes too fussy like lots of others have said being poor cook is very fixable my husband was terrible cook when we were dating now he pretty good but still needs someone to tell him what to cook think you can learn lot just by being around it watch cooking shows lots of good ones on pbs atk and cooks country are also on youtube cook with friends family that can cook you can stir or cut up the onions for them and watch do think formal lessons are critical get meat thermometer and use it that will stop over undercooked meat and casseroles usually you need gt 150 for casserole less if nothing you added was raw other things **taste them** while you are cooking if it not good adjust never be afraid to add salt if something is bland like 80 of american salt intake is from processed food not your shaker in the kitchen foolproof recipe ziti lasagna only slightly healthy *cook 1lb of hamburger meat with salt and pepper ~2t ea *cook 1lb of ziti or penne pasta according to the box drain it *mix meat pasta jar of your favorite spaghetti sauce *put half the mix in casserole dish *mix 1lb of ricotta or cottage cheese with egg 5c of bagged italian cheese and ~2t ea salt pepper and garlic powder *put cheese mix in dish *put the rest of the pasta mix in the dish *cover with remaining 5c of italian cheese *bake 350 until an internal temp of 140 broil if needed to brown cheese am so jealous your husband doesnt come from family of good cooks lol my husbands mother was great cook and also had maids that cooked him perfect meals all the time its so hard to live up to thanks for the encouragement okay after reading all the replies seems like the average number of years to become decent cook is years ive been married for about yrs but only started cooking regularly about year ago have some hope now thanks for suggestion ill check it out thank you my husband and are korean american so we like lot of asian food too ll have to check out those youtube channels this is me usually have my toddlers yelling and getting in my way in the kitchen so even if im tasting the food as cook cant tell if its seasoned enough or not my food always ends up too bland or too salty grew up with mother who was and still is an absolutely terrible cook but she is an awesome amazing mother so do your best and do sweat it everyone should know how to make spaghetti get more water than you think you need boiling while you dice up an onion when the water begins to boil toss in less spaghetti than you think you need ask alexa to set timer for whatever the box says and set your colander in the sink drain when alexa says to and forget your pasta in the sink toss that onion in the same pot you just used with tablespoon of olive oil and cover it over low heat go check on your kids because it has been minute when your onion is translucent and certainly not brown or black toss 69 cent can of tomatoes on top of the onion add double the amount of salt you think you need tsp of sugar all the basil and oregano you have in the cupboard stir it up and add that cold pasta back in if you have frozen meatball in the freezer nuke it and put it on top serve it with some sprinkle cheese on top thanks for sharing and used to feel that exact same way did know the first thing about cooking when my husband and started dating made him pork chops once and thought broil meant to keep something warm and put them in the oven to under broil to keep them warm until everything else was done and needless to say they came out more like potato chips than chops did lot of the same things as mentioned above to learn how to cook watched some shorter cooking shows 30 mins long mostly rachel ray as felt like she gave some great tips for working efficiently in the kitchen and just seeing how to she chopped and prepped was helpful now there so much content on youtube that bet you could search for particular topic and learn lot about it quickly talked with family members who were good cooks and learned from them at family events actually asked them if could hang out in the kitchen with them so could watch learn help tried one new recipe each week took cooking class through local program that offered adult education classes for fun during the evenings tried to be easy on myself when things did turn out the way expected and still try to do that now at the very least feel like my family knows tried cooking nice meal and when my kids sometimes comment on how they might not like something try to use it as teaching moment and tell them thought they might enjoy this and tried to make dinner they and sometimes things do turn out the way you expect that part of cooking and life and then we just try to roll with it slow cooker and one pot meals are the best now get my kids involved with picking out recipes and we pick together from things we think we ll both enjoy also have them involved in washing and my oldest with some chopping that can be bit harder when you re still learning to cook but find the kiddos eat the meal more readily when they ve helped prepare it amp x200b not mom just like browsing different subs to get feel for what other go through however my advice to you as someone who has taken on the task of learning to cook better is to turn the heat doooooooooown everything doesn require high heat and things can still cooked thoroughly on medium setting was never good cook until this past year as stay at home mom just started with basic things and slowly learned new recipes over time you will get the hang of things ask your partner for their feedback ask yourself what is lacking you can always take small portions out of things and add different seasonings to see if you can make better combo for the whole portion it takes time used to feel hopeless but much more confident after year of being the main cook
